meanings.definition: To crouch or sit on one's heels
meanings.sent1: He squats down to tie his shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: She squats on the floor to play with her toys.
meanings.sent3: The cat squats to pounce on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The frog squats patiently by the pond, waiting for a fly.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker squats to rest and catch his breath.

meanings.definition: A type of exercise involving bending the knees and lowering the body
meanings.sent1: She does squats to strengthen her leg muscles.
meanings.sent2: Squats are great for building lower body strength.
meanings.sent3: The fitness instructor led the class in a set of squats.
meanings.sent4: After doing squats, her legs felt like jelly.
meanings.sent5: He added squats to his workout routine for better balance.

meanings.definition: A position in which a person or animal sits close to the ground
meanings.sent1: The dog found a comfortable squat under the tree.
meanings.sent2: The children sat in a squat to play marbles.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel did a little squat before darting up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The yoga pose called the squat helps improve flexibility.
meanings.sent5: The frog's squat made it almost invisible among the leaves.
